title: Jaylen Brown seemingly criticizes officiating again following Celtics’ loss to Magic
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Jaylen Brown expressed frustration with officiating after the Celtics' 123-110 loss to the Magic.
Brown previously criticized refs during a 105-103 loss to the Jazz, citing a crucial missed foul call.
Despite scoring 32 points against the Magic, Brown struggled in the fourth quarter, going 1 of 5 from the field.

title: 5 things to know about Buccaneers ahead of Sunday’s game vs. Patriots
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Baker Mayfield leads the Buccaneers with 1,919 passing yards and 13 touchdowns, positioning him as an MVP contender.
Rookie receiver Emeka Egbuka has 562 yards and five touchdowns, showing potential as Offensive Rookie of the Year.
Buccaneers face key injuries, lacking starting running back Bucky Irving and top receivers Mike Evans and Chris Godwin.

title: Patriots’ return to relevance includes appearance by Jim Nantz in TV booth to call game for CBS
author: Chad Finn
bullets: Jim Nantz and Tony Romo will call the Patriots-Buccaneers game, marking their first Patriots game since 2023.
The Patriots' improved performance is highlighted by key figures Drake Maye and Mike Vrabel attracting top CBS broadcasters.
Nantz previously called his 100th Patriots game in 2020, showing his long association with the team during its dynasty.

title: Magic pull away, beat Celtics despite another big Jaylen Brown game: 8 takeaways
author: Tom Westerholm
bullets: The Boston Celtics lost to the Orlando Magic 123-110, marking their first defeat in the NBA Cup.
Jaylen Brown scored 32 points on 15-for-28 shooting but struggled from three-point range, going 1-for-6.
The Celtics' defense allowed the Magic to make 17 3-pointers, contributing to Boston's loss.

title: Public reprimand recommended for judge accused of helping immigrant escape ICE
author: Morgan Rousseau
bullets: Judge Shelley Joseph faces a public reprimand for creating an 'appearance of impropriety' in a 2018 ICE-related case.
Hearing officer Denis J. McInerney found Joseph unaware of any escape plan, recommending a public reprimand despite no misconduct.
Federal charges against Joseph for obstruction of justice were dropped in 2022 after agreeing to a state misconduct investigation.

title: Alex Cora still high on Red Sox’ future a month after being eliminated by Yankees
author: Kaley Brown
bullets: The Red Sox were eliminated by the Yankees in the AL Wild Card Series, ending their 2025 season.
Manager Alex Cora remains optimistic about the team's future, highlighting postseason experience and roster development.
Key roster changes include Trevor Story opting in and Alex Bregman opting out of their contracts with the Red Sox.

title: Giant blade breaks off Mass. wind turbine
author: Morgan Rousseau
bullets: A 75-100 foot blade detached from a 300-foot wind turbine in Plymouth, Massachusetts, landing in a cranberry bog.
The incident occurred near 810 Head of the Bay Road; there were no injuries or public safety threats reported.
The turbine automatically entered fail-safe mode upon blade detachment; the incident is under investigation by local authorities.

title: 5 must-watch movies & TV shows streaming right now
author: Kevin Slane
bullets: 'The Fantastic Four: First Steps' is streaming on Disney+; it marks Marvel's entry into Phase 6 of the MCU.
'Frankenstein', directed by Guillermo del Toro, offers a unique take on Mary Shelley's novel; now streaming on Netflix.
'Materialists', a satirical romcom starring Dakota Johnson, is available on HBO Max, exploring modern romance themes.

title: Stefon Diggs reveals what he’s trying to improve about himself after 11 years in the NFL
author: Kaley Brown
bullets: Stefon Diggs, in his 11th NFL season, aims to improve his attitude, seeking perfection and maintaining a competitive edge.
Diggs has contributed significantly to the New England Patriots' success, leading in receiving yards and receptions this season.
He credits offensive coaches Josh McDaniels and Todd Downing for fostering a productive, opportunity-rich environment for improvement.

title: Commuter train plows through car on tracks in Acton
author: Morgan Rousseau
bullets: An MBTA commuter train collided with an empty car at a railroad crossing in Acton; no injuries were reported.
The car was pushed 300 feet after its driver allegedly bypassed crossing gates and exited before the crash.
Fitchburg line commuters experienced delays; Train 1427 was terminated at South Acton due to the incident.
